instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.R5281: What is R5281? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
Greetings to all, my name is Jose, I am from Chile. am glad to be in the forum. I need som help.

A few days ago I received a 2012 MBP with a short circuit in the <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> line. the short was in the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>, replace it an the board turn on. I connect the screen and everything is fine.
the problem is <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.22 volts and the battery is not charging. I replace the ISL Again and no change. replace the SMC and no change.
I need your help guys.
thanks. sorry for my English.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
First of all Â¡Bienvenido al foro!

Stop to change components without a good reason.
Post voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
If no good, check again disconnecting BIL cable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
thank you [USER=682][B]2informaticos[/B][/USER] for your reply.
here is the data you request

SCL= 0.543 - oscilating 3.445 and 3,479
SDA= 0.536 - stable 3,476

<RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR>= 1,979 ohms
<RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR>= 1,996 ohms

(check again disconnecting BIL cable.), the board is in the desk.
the original smc is installed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
data whit out <DIODE>D6950</DIODE>

SCL= 0.545 - oscilating 3.441 and 3,479
SDA= 0.538 - stable 3,476
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>= 12,28 v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7000</RESISTOR> is good?
Remove also <CAPACITOR>C6952</CAPACITOR>/53.
Check SCL/SDA continuity between <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, J6950, <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR>/81 and corresponding pads under SMC.
Be sure to use SMC from same model board.
